creator: nicfournier@yahoo.com
text:
I'm trying to make a struts exemple I found on the internet work. It is 
available here:
http://www.keyboardmonkey.com/pilotlight/monkey-tree/monkey-tree-02.jsp?
content=yesplease

It is an example of how to use struts nested jsp tags to do a tree. Running it 
in Tomcat 4.1.24 with struts 1.1 RC1 demonstrate a wrong behavior. In the 
tree, childs are duplicated instead of beeing  unique. Hard to explain, you 
have to see for yourself. I have reproduced the problem with Tomcat 4.1.24 but 
not with Tomcat 4.0. I also tried with Jetty and Jetty that uses jasper from 
tomcat 4.0 works but the problem is found in Jetty that uses jasper from 
Tomcat 4.1. So I think it is pretty clear that the problems lies in the new 
jasper found in tomcat 4.1.

If you need more info, just ask.

Thanks,
nicfournier.

Created attachment 5978
The packaged war file that demonstrate the behavior (only thing missing is struts 1.1 rc1 in WEB-INF/lib).
creator: nicfournier@yahoo.com
remm@apache.org
text:
Personally, I think the problem is with tag pooling (whatever taglibs used by
the webapp are not spec compliant).

creator: nicfournier@yahoo.com
text: So you think the bug would be in struts ??

Possibly. Almost every time that type of bug was reported, it was a problem with
the tag. You can test that by disabling tag pooling and see if it works better
(modify the appropriate boolean in conf/web.xml, clear the work directory, and
try the app again). If it works then, it's a problem with a taglib used by the
application.
creator: remm@apache.org
nicfournier@yahoo.com
text:
I disabled tag pooling and the behavior is now right. Thanks a lot. So, now do 
you know where the bug would be, in a commons used by struts or struts itself?

Thanks again!

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
The bug is in one of the Struts taglibs used by the application; more
investigation would be reauired to determine what's wrong. I can't help much
with that; all I can say is that it won't be fixed in Tomcat, as tags
incompatible with pooling are not spec compliant.
